title: unused diagnostics give bad suggestion in the face of unreachable code

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
The `unused_variables` lint fires for variables that are "used" after a function returns or diverges.  If the suggestion is applied, this causes the code to fail to compile.  

(I presume there is probably already a similar issue on this, but I can't find one.)

Found during the 2021 crater run in https://github.com/Buzov/StudyOfRust

I tried this code:

```rust
fn foo() -> i32 {
    let x = 123;
    return 1;
    x
}

fn bar() -> i32 {
    let x = 456;
    todo!();
    x
}
```

I expected to see this happen: Ideally I think the `unused_variables` should not be emitted if the variable is actually used (just in unreachable space).

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.56.0-nightly (b03ccace5 2021-08-24)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: b03ccace573bb91e27625c190a0f7807045a1012
commit-date: 2021-08-24
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.56.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```
